Key Match Events: Papua New Guinea recover from 50-4 to post 136-8
Post-Match Reflections: Assad Vala: 'It was a competitive score but we believe we missed a trick at the end, another 10 or 15 runs would've been nice'

Rovman Powell: 'Credit to PNG, their plans were simple and they played good cricket. It's important to start well and that's what we did. We gave them 10-15 runs too much and we will look to tighten up when bowling. They showed intent and played smartly.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: England open their tournament against Scotland on Tuesday 4 June
Roland Butcher: 'The lack of preparation has a huge effect. If West Indies were playing a stronger team they'd have lost that game.'
Geraint Jones: 'Papua New Guinea can be proud. They should be really happy with that start and they can take a lot of confidence into other games.'
Simon Mann: 'Papua New Guinea have had a good day out. They've pushed the hosts and one of the tournament favourites hard.'
Others: The game was played in Group C of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup
The match was played on 2 June 2024
